title: Why are many Firefox passwords showing the same “last used/updated” date, even for sites I didn’t visit?
content:
Could this be due to a Firefox update, extension (e.g. LastPass), or syncing?

I’ve noticed in Firefox Password Manager that a large number of saved logins all show the same “last used/updated” date in the past (e.g. July 2020). This includes websites that I know I did not visit or log into at that time.

I am now in a situation where I’m being accused of attempting to access a site on that specific date, but I strongly believe I did not.

Can anyone clarify whether this behaviour could be explained by something like: 

- A Firefox update,

- The installation or update of a browser extension (such as LastPass), or

- A syncing/importing process that might change timestamps for multiple entries at once?

I’ve attached screenshots from Firefox to show how this appears....there are LOTS of sites that have this date on them, not just the one that I am being accused of trying to access.

Any insight into why these “used/updated” dates might change in bulk would be extremely helpful.

title: Error 403 when I try to access Github only
content:
Whenever I try to open Github specifically I get:

Websites prove their identity via certificates. Firefox does not trust this site because it uses a certificate that is not valid for github.com. The certificate is only valid for the following names: cloudflare-dns.com, *.cloudflare-dns.com, one.one.one.one

Error code: SSL_ERROR_BAD_CERT_DOMAIN

I spent time looking into this, used a new IP address and tried updating the certificate for github, however I'm not particularly skilled when it comes to this, so any assistance would be much appreciated.

title: eesrchrdr.com
content:
Bonjour, lorsque je tape un mot dans la barre de recherche, le moteur de recherche google (qui est definit comme moteur de recherche par default) m'affiche les sites qu'il a trouvé, et de suite après, la recherche se relance automatiquement avec une adresse https://eesrchrdr.com/... avant de basculer sur http://fr.search.yahoo.com/... et m'affiche les recherche effectué par yahoo. Je ne comprend pas pourquoi le moteur de recherche google qui est selectionné dans les parametres se fait automatiquement remplacer par yahoo.

Hello, When I type a word in the search bar, the Google search engine (which is set as the default search engine) shows me the sites it found, and immediately afterward, the search automatically restarts with the address https://eesrchrdr.com/... before switching to http://fr.search.yahoo.com/... and shows me the searches performed by Yahoo. I don't understand why the Google search engine selected in the settings is automatically replaced by Yahoo.

title: How to add film credit to Wikipedia article on Robert Berry
content:
I wish to add a film credit to the Wikipedia article on Robert Berry. In 1975 Robert Berry wrote and performed the music for The Milpitas Monster Movie released May 20th 1976. A 45 R.P.M Stereo Record was produced with Janell Records BMI SIDE 1 Milpitas Monster SIDE 2 Dining on the Dump. Robert's 10 sound on sound recordings also included theactric music themes throughout the entire movie, for The Monster, The Emergency Task Force, The Class Clowns, The Town Drunk, and a Music crescendo for Opening Title and Closing Credits. 

                                              Visit more at milpitasmonster.com                              © PA 1-978-315 Effective Date of Registration September 08 2014.           The Director's Cut of the Milpitas Monster Previous Alternative Title: The Milpitas Monster.           ~ A filmed Interview of Robert Berry with Robert Burrill is within the DVD EXTRAS within 2-DVD-Set ~

The Milpitas Monster Movie Makers celebrate their 49th Annual screening Oct 26 at the Niles Essany Silent Film Museum Sunday at 1PM. The 50 year Anniversary is May 20th 2026 at The Milpitas Great Mall Cinemark Century Theaters. Additional 2026 screenings are July 4th & Oct 30th.

title: Firefox disables my internet connection
content:
Hi. I've been having trouble with Firefox.

When I enter a certain website (https://app.helpwise.io/) using my PC, after a few minutes my internet connection gets disabled. When I try to run 'Diagnose Network Problems' in Win11, no issues.

First time this happened, a restart fixed the problem. Second time, a DNS flush fixed it. But after that, those solutions don't work anymore.

I initially thought it was that website (which I use for work) but I tried running that website on my Android phone using Firefox as well and I did not have any connectivity issues.

So, I tried running the website in Chrome - no issues. I did work side by side with Firefox opened as all my bookmarks for work are there, and eventually after a few hours my internet was disconnected again - even though https://app.helpwise.io/ was not opened in Firefox.

I have tried refreshing Firefox, then disabling all extensions and running https://app.helpwise.io/ and still it immediately disabled my internet.

There are some times that it even turned OFF my Avast anti-virus.

I have tried running Avast and Malwarebytes and no virus or malware was detected.

I still want to use Firefox and I'm now thinking of formatting my computer. But when I run Firefox again after formatting, I may have the same issue.

Can anyone help?

title: Vertical Tab Groups
content: I use vertical tabs and the new tab group feature which allows you to assign a group heading for 1 or more tabs. When I right click on a tab I can create a new tab group. Below this option is a button labeled "Closed Groups". If I want to use one of these and check it, the tab I want to assign to it is closed and the group name is not listed in the sidebar. It seems the "Closed Groups" can no longer be used. There is no way to get rid of them and I end up creating duplicates as new tab groups with the same names. I want to either delete the Closed Groups or be able to reuse them. Any solution for this problem?
